To the chief Musician<S>5329</S>, A Psalm<S>4210</S> of David<S>1732</S>. I waited<S>6960</S> patiently<S>6960</S> for the LORD<S>3068</S>; and he inclined<S>5186</S> unto me, and heard<S>8085</S> my cry<S>7775</S>. <sup>I waited: Heb. In waiting I waited</sup>
He brought me up<S>5927</S> also out of an horrible<S>7588</S> pit<S>953</S>, out of the miry<S>3121</S> clay<S>2916</S>, and set<S>6965</S> my feet<S>7272</S> upon a rock<S>5553</S>, and established<S>3559</S> my goings<S>838</S>. <sup>an: Heb. a pit of noise</sup>
And he hath put<S>5414</S> a new<S>2319</S> song<S>7892</S> in my mouth<S>6310</S>, even praise<S>8416</S> unto our God<S>430</S>: many<S>7227</S> shall see<S>7200</S> it, and fear<S>3372</S>, and shall trust<S>982</S> in the LORD<S>3068</S>.
Blessed<S>835</S> is that man<S>1397</S> that maketh<S>7760</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> his trust<S>4009</S>, and respecteth<S>6437</S> not the proud<S>7295</S>, nor such as turn aside<S>7750</S> to lies<S>3577</S>.
Many<S>7227</S>, O LORD<S>3068</S> my God<S>430</S>, are thy wonderful<S>6381</S> works which thou hast done<S>6213</S>, and thy thoughts<S>4284</S> which are to us-ward: they cannot be reckoned up in order<S>6186</S> unto thee: if I would declare<S>5046</S> and speak<S>1696</S> of them, they are more<S>6105</S> than can be numbered<S>5608</S>. <sup>they cannot: or, none can order them unto thee</sup>
Sacrifice<S>2077</S> and offering<S>4503</S> thou didst not desire<S>2654</S>; mine ears<S>241</S> hast thou opened<S>3738</S>: burnt offering<S>5930</S> and sin offering<S>2401</S> hast thou not required<S>7592</S>. <sup>opened: Heb. digged</sup>
Then said<S>559</S> I, Lo, I come<S>935</S>: in the volume<S>4039</S> of the book<S>5612</S> it is written<S>3789</S> of me,
I delight<S>2654</S> to do<S>6213</S> thy will<S>7522</S>, O my God<S>430</S>: yea, thy law<S>8451</S> is within<S>8432</S> my heart<S>4578</S>. <sup>within: Heb. in the midst of my bowels</sup>
I have preached<S>1319</S> righteousness<S>6664</S> in the great<S>7227</S> congregation<S>6951</S>: lo, I have not refrained<S>3607</S> my lips<S>8193</S>, O LORD<S>3068</S>, thou knowest<S>3045</S>.
I have not hid<S>3680</S> thy righteousness<S>6666</S> within<S>8432</S> my heart<S>3820</S>; I have declared<S>559</S> thy faithfulness<S>530</S> and thy salvation<S>8668</S>: I have not concealed<S>3582</S> thy lovingkindness<S>2617</S> and thy truth<S>571</S> from the great<S>7227</S> congregation<S>6951</S>.
Withhold<S>3607</S> not thou thy tender mercies<S>7356</S> from me, O LORD<S>3068</S>: let thy lovingkindness<S>2617</S> and thy truth<S>571</S> continually<S>8548</S> preserve<S>5341</S> me.
For innumerable<S>4557</S> evils<S>7451</S> have compassed<S>661</S> me about: mine iniquities<S>5771</S> have taken hold<S>5381</S> upon me, so that I am not able<S>3201</S> to look up<S>7200</S>; they are more<S>6105</S> than the hairs<S>8185</S> of mine head<S>7218</S>: therefore my heart<S>3820</S> faileth<S>5800</S> me. <sup>falleth: Heb. forsaketh</sup>
Be pleased<S>7521</S>, O LORD<S>3068</S>, to deliver<S>5337</S> me: O LORD<S>3068</S>, make haste<S>2363</S> to help<S>5833</S> me.
Let them be ashamed<S>954</S> and confounded<S>2659</S> together<S>3162</S> that seek<S>1245</S> after my soul<S>5315</S> to destroy<S>5595</S> it; let them be driven<S>5472</S> backward<S>268</S> and put to shame<S>3637</S> that wish<S>2655</S> me evil<S>7451</S>.
Let them be desolate<S>8074</S> for a reward<S>6118</S> of their shame<S>1322</S> that say<S>559</S> unto me, Aha<S>1889</S>, aha<S>1889</S>.
Let all those that seek<S>1245</S> thee rejoice<S>7797</S> and be glad<S>8055</S> in thee: let such as love<S>157</S> thy salvation<S>8668</S> say<S>559</S> continually<S>8548</S>, The LORD<S>3068</S> be magnified<S>1431</S>.
But I am poor<S>6041</S> and needy<S>34</S>; yet the Lord<S>136</S> thinketh<S>2803</S> upon me: thou art my help<S>5833</S> and my deliverer<S>6403</S>; make no tarrying<S>309</S>, O my God<S>430</S>.
